Hello everyone,

I've been following this group for some time and it was qu=
ite 
educational. But now the time has come to ask a few questions, 
becaus=
e for over two months now I've been trying very hard to get my 
project wor=
king - without success. As I am totally new to NEAT, my 
questions may soun=
d trivial or naive to you, so please don't be 
offended by that. I read a l=
ot of earlier posts on this group, but I 
didn't have the time to read them=
 all. Additionally, as I'm German, 
my English may be not very good, but I'=
m trying my best. ;)

My project includes the following facts: 3-degrees-of=
-freedom robotic 
arm (dynamic simulation with gravitation), for each joint=
 three 
inputs (current joint angle, goal joint angle, current speed) and o=
ne 
output (motor command), all inputs are scaled to [-1;1] before being 
f=
ed to the system, all other nodes are sigmoid [0;1]. The arm gets 6 
traini=
ng samples with different start and goal angles, each sample 
consisting of=
 500 timesteps. In each of these 3000 timesteps, the 
difference between cu=
rrent and goal angles is calculated. The sum of 
these differences becomes =
the errorsum. I assume this is not the best 
fitness function for this prob=
lem, but it should work to continually 
reduce the mean difference and ther=
efor to make the arm "want" to go 
to the goal.

My problem is the followin=
g: I do not know which kind of settings for 
the parameters I should use fo=
r such an experiment. I tried tons of 
possibilites, but without any signif=
icant results. Most of the time, 
there is a gradual improvement in fitness=
, but after some time it 
just stagnates and doesn't evolve any further at =
all. I thought this 
to be a problem of overcomplexification, so I scaled d=
own the 
add_node_probability, which in turn resulted in slower learning 
c=
urve, but after some time the same stagnation.
So to clearify this: My main=
 problem is stagnation after some time 
without having produced reasonable =
results. What can I do about it? 
What's it's cause and what can I do to ge=
t it done right? 

I would very much appreciate your helpful advice!
With b=
est regards,
Matthias
